interfaces.label: HttpFetchOptions
description: All options that may be used with a {@link HttpHandler}.

children.label: query
description: The query string for an HTTP request. See {@link HttpFetchQuery}.

children.label: prependBasePath
description: Whether or not the request should automatically prepend the basePath. Defaults to `true`.

children.label: headers
description: Headers to send with the request. See {@link HttpHeadersInit}.

children.label: asSystemRequest
description:
Whether or not the request should include the "system request" header to differentiate an end user request from
Kibana internal request.
Can be read on the server-side using KibanaRequest#isSystemRequest. Defaults to `false`.

children.label: asResponse
description:
When `true` the return type of {@link HttpHandler} will be an {@link HttpResponse} with detailed request and
response information. When `false`, the return type will just be the parsed response body. Defaults to `false`.

interfaces.label: HttpFetchOptionsWithPath
description: Similar to {@link HttpFetchOptions} but with the URL path included.

children.label: Unnamed
description:
TypeScript note: Technically we should use this interface instead, but @types/node uses the below stricter
definition, so to avoid TypeScript errors, we'll restrict our version.

[key: string]:
  | string
  | number
  | boolean
  | Array<string | number | boolean>
  | undefined
  | null;

interfaces.label: HttpHandler
description:
A function for making an HTTP requests to Kibana's backend. See {@link HttpFetchOptions} for options and
{@link HttpResponse} for the response.

interfaces.label: HttpHeadersInit
description:
Headers to append to the request. Any headers that begin with `kbn-` are considered private to Core and will cause
{@link HttpHandler} to throw an error.

interfaces.label: HttpInterceptor
description:
An object that may define global interceptor functions for different parts of the request and response lifecycle.
See {@link IHttpInterceptController}.

children.label: request
description: Define an interceptor to be executed before a request is sent.

children.label: requestError
description: Define an interceptor to be executed if a request interceptor throws an error or returns a rejected Promise.

children.label: response
description: Define an interceptor to be executed after a response is received.

children.label: responseError
description: Define an interceptor to be executed if a response interceptor throws an error or returns a rejected Promise.

interfaces.label: HttpRequestInit
description: Fetch API options available to {@link HttpHandler}s.

children.label: body
description: A BodyInit object or null to set request's body.
signature: string | ArrayBuffer | Blob | URLSearchParams | ArrayBufferView | FormData | ReadableStream<Uint8Array> | null | undefined

children.label: cache
description:
The cache mode associated with request, which is a string indicating how the request will interact with the
browser's cache when fetching.

children.label: credentials
description:
The credentials mode associated with request, which is a string indicating whether credentials will be sent with
the request always, never, or only when sent to a same-origin URL.

children.label: headers
description: {@link HttpHeadersInit}

children.label: integrity
description:
Subresource integrity metadata, which is a cryptographic hash of the resource being fetched. Its value consists of
multiple hashes separated by whitespace.

children.label: keepalive
description: Whether or not request can outlive the global in which it was created.

children.label: method
description: HTTP method, which is "GET" by default.

children.label: mode
description:
The mode associated with request, which is a string indicating whether the request will use CORS, or will be
restricted to same-origin URLs.

children.label: redirect
description:
The redirect mode associated with request, which is a string indicating how redirects for the request will be
handled during fetching. A request will follow redirects by default.

children.label: referrer
description:
The referrer of request. Its value can be a same-origin URL if explicitly set in init, the empty string to
indicate no referrer, and "about:client" when defaulting to the global's default. This is used during fetching to
determine the value of the `Referer` header of the request being made.

children.label: referrerPolicy
description:
The referrer policy associated with request. This is used during fetching to compute the value of the request's
referrer.

children.label: signal
description:
Returns the signal associated with request, which is an AbortSignal object indicating whether or not request has
been aborted, and its abort event handler.

children.label: window
description: Can only be null. Used to disassociate request from any Window.

children.label: fetchOptions
description: The original {@link HttpFetchOptionsWithPath} used to send this request.

children.label: request
description: Raw request sent to Kibana server.

children.label: response
description: Raw response received, may be undefined if there was an error.

children.label: body
description: Parsed body received, may be undefined if there was an error.

children.label: basePath
description:
APIs for manipulating the basePath on URL segments.
See {@link IBasePath}

children.label: anonymousPaths
description: APIs for denoting certain paths for not requiring authentication

children.label: intercept
description: Adds a new {@link HttpInterceptor} to the global HTTP client.

children.label: interceptor
description: a {@link HttpInterceptor}

returnComment: a function for removing the attached interceptor.

children.label: fetch
description: Makes an HTTP request. Defaults to a GET request unless overriden. See {@link HttpHandler} for options.

children.label: delete
description: Makes an HTTP request with the DELETE method. See {@link HttpHandler} for options.

children.label: get
description: Makes an HTTP request with the GET method. See {@link HttpHandler} for options.

children.label: head
description: Makes an HTTP request with the HEAD method. See {@link HttpHandler} for options.

children.label: options
description: Makes an HTTP request with the OPTIONS method. See {@link HttpHandler} for options.

children.label: patch
description: Makes an HTTP request with the PATCH method. See {@link HttpHandler} for options.

children.label: post
description: Makes an HTTP request with the POST method. See {@link HttpHandler} for options.

children.label: put
description: Makes an HTTP request with the PUT method. See {@link HttpHandler} for options.

children.label: addLoadingCountSource
description:
Adds a new source of loading counts. Used to show the global loading indicator when sum of all observed counts are
more than 0.

children.label: countSource$
description: an Observable to subscribe to for loading count updates.

children.label: getLoadingCount$
description: Get the sum of all loading count sources as a single Observable.

interfaces.label: IAnonymousPaths
description: APIs for denoting paths as not requiring authentication

children.label: isAnonymous
description: Determines whether the provided path doesn't require authentication. `path` should include the current basePath.

children.label: register
description: Register `path` as not requiring authentication. `path` should not include the current basePath.

interfaces.label: IBasePath
description: APIs for manipulating the basePath on URL segments.

children.label: get
description: Gets the `basePath` string.

children.label: prepend
description: Prepends `path` with the basePath.

children.label: remove
description: Removes the prepended basePath from the `path`.

children.label: serverBasePath
description:
Returns the server's root basePath as configured, without any namespace prefix.

See {@link BasePath.get} for getting the basePath value for a specific request

children.label: publicBaseUrl
description:
The server's publicly exposed base URL, if configured. Includes protocol, host, port (optional) and the
{@link IBasePath.serverBasePath}.

interfaces.label: IExternalUrl
description: APIs for working with external URLs.

children.label: validateUrl
description:
Determines if the provided URL is a valid location to send users.
Validation is based on the configured allow list in kibana.yml.

If the URL is valid, then a URL will be returned.
Otherwise, this will return null.

interfaces.label: IHttpInterceptController
description: Used to halt a request Promise chain in a {@link HttpInterceptor}.

children.label: halted
description: Whether or not this chain has been halted.

children.label: halt
description: Halt the request Promise chain and do not process further interceptors or response handlers.

interfaces.label: IHttpResponseInterceptorOverrides
description: Properties that can be returned by HttpInterceptor.request to override the response.

children.label: response
description: Raw response received, may be undefined if there was an error.

children.label: body
description: Parsed body received, may be undefined if there was an error.

misc.label: HttpStart
description: See {@link HttpSetup}

classes.label: BasePath
description: Access or manipulate the Kibana base path

children.label: serverBasePath
description:
returns the server's basePath

See {@link BasePath.get} for getting the basePath value for a specific request

children.label: publicBaseUrl
description:
The server's publicly exposed base URL, if configured. Includes protocol, host, port (optional) and the
{@link BasePath.serverBasePath}.

children.label: get
description: returns `basePath` value, specific for an incoming request.

children.label: set
description: sets `basePath` value, specific for an incoming request.

children.label: prepend
description: Prepends `path` with the basePath.

children.label: remove
description: Removes the prepended basePath from the `path`.

classes.label: KibanaRequest
description: Kibana specific abstraction for an incoming request.

children.label: id
description: A identifier to identify this request.

children.label: uuid
description: A UUID to identify this request.

children.label: url
description: a WHATWG URL standard object.

children.label: route
description: matched route details

children.label: headers
description: Readonly copy of incoming request headers.

children.label: isSystemRequest
description:
Whether or not the request is a "system request" rather than an application-level request.
Can be set on the client using the `HttpFetchOptions#asSystemRequest` option.

children.label: socket
description: {@link IKibanaSocket}

children.label: events
description: Request events {@link KibanaRequestEvents}

children.label: rewrittenUrl
description: URL rewritten in onPreRouting request interceptor.

classes.label: RouteValidationError
description: Error to return when the validation is not successful.

interfaces.label: AuthRedirectedParams
description: Result of auth redirection.

children.label: headers
description:
Headers to attach for auth redirect.
Must include "location" header
signature: ({ location: string; } & Record<"accept" | "accept-language" | "accept-patch" | "accept-ranges" | "access-control-allow-credentials" | "access-control-allow-headers" | "access-control-allow-methods" | "access-control-allow-origin" | "access-control-expose-headers" | "access-control-max-age" | "access-control-request-headers" | "access-control-request-method" | "age" | "allow" | "alt-svc" | "authorization" | "cache-control" | "connection" | "content-disposition" | "content-encoding" | "content-language" | "content-length" | "content-location" | "content-range" | "content-type" | "cookie" | "date" | "expect" | "expires" | "forwarded" | "from" | "host" | "if-match" | "if-modified-since" | "if-none-match" | "if-unmodified-since" | "last-modified" | "location" | "origin" | "pragma" | "proxy-authenticate" | "proxy-authorization" | "public-key-pins" | "range" | "referer" | "retry-after" | "sec-websocket-accept" | "sec-websocket-extensions" | "sec-websocket-key" | "sec-websocket-protocol" | "sec-websocket-version" | "set-cookie" | "strict-transport-security" | "tk" | "trailer" | "transfer-encoding" | "upgrade" | "user-agent" | "vary" | "via" | "warning" | "www-authenticate", string | string[]>) | ({ location: string; } & Record<string, string | string[]>)

interfaces.label: AuthResultParams
description: Result of successful authentication.

children.label: state
description: Data to associate with an incoming request. Any downstream plugin may get access to the data.

children.label: requestHeaders
description:
Auth specific headers to attach to a request object.
Used to perform a request to Elasticsearch on behalf of an authenticated user.

children.label: responseHeaders
description:
Auth specific headers to attach to a response object.
Used to send back authentication mechanism related headers to a client when needed.

children.label: authenticated
description: Authentication is successful with given credentials, allow request to pass through

children.label: notHandled
description:
User has no credentials.
Allows user to access a resource when authRequired is 'optional'
Rejects a request when authRequired: true

children.label: redirected
description:
Redirects user to another location to complete authentication when authRequired: true
Allows user to access a resource without redirection when authRequired: 'optional'
signature: (headers: ({ location: string; } & Record<"accept" | "accept-language" | "accept-patch" | "accept-ranges" | "access-control-allow-credentials" | "access-control-allow-headers" | "access-control-allow-methods" | "access-control-allow-origin" | "access-control-expose-headers" | "access-control-max-age" | "access-control-request-headers" | "access-control-request-method" | "age" | "allow" | "alt-svc" | "authorization" | "cache-control" | "connection" | "content-disposition" | "content-encoding" | "content-language" | "content-length" | "content-location" | "content-range" | "content-type" | "cookie" | "date" | "expect" | "expires" | "forwarded" | "from" | "host" | "if-match" | "if-modified-since" | "if-none-match" | "if-unmodified-since" | "last-modified" | "location" | "origin" | "pragma" | "proxy-authenticate" | "proxy-authorization" | "public-key-pins" | "range" | "referer" | "retry-after" | "sec-websocket-accept" | "sec-websocket-extensions" | "sec-websocket-key" | "sec-websocket-protocol" | "sec-websocket-version" | "set-cookie" | "strict-transport-security" | "tk" | "trailer" | "transfer-encoding" | "upgrade" | "user-agent" | "vary" | "via" | "warning" | "www-authenticate", string | string[]>) | ({ location: string; } & Record<string, string | string[]>)) =>

interfaces.label: CustomHttpResponseOptions
description: HTTP response parameters for a response with adjustable status code.

children.label: body
description: HTTP message to send to the client

children.label: headers
description: HTTP Headers with additional information about response
signature: Record<"accept" | "accept-language" | "accept-patch" | "accept-ranges" | "access-control-allow-credentials" | "access-control-allow-headers" | "access-control-allow-methods" | "access-control-allow-origin" | "access-control-expose-headers" | "access-control-max-age" | "access-control-request-headers" | "access-control-request-method" | "age" | "allow" | "alt-svc" | "authorization" | "cache-control" | "connection" | "content-disposition" | "content-encoding" | "content-language" | "content-length" | "content-location" | "content-range" | "content-type" | "cookie" | "date" | "expect" | "expires" | "forwarded" | "from" | "host" | "if-match" | "if-modified-since" | "if-none-match" | "if-unmodified-since" | "last-modified" | "location" | "origin" | "pragma" | "proxy-authenticate" | "proxy-authorization" | "public-key-pins" | "range" | "referer" | "retry-after" | "sec-websocket-accept" | "sec-websocket-extensions" | "sec-websocket-key" | "sec-websocket-protocol" | "sec-websocket-version" | "set-cookie" | "strict-transport-security" | "tk" | "trailer" | "transfer-encoding" | "upgrade" | "user-agent" | "vary" | "via" | "warning" | "www-authenticate", string | string[]> | Record<string, string | string[]> | undefined

children.label: bypassErrorFormat
description: Bypass the default error formatting

interfaces.label: ErrorHttpResponseOptions
description: HTTP response parameters

children.label: body
description: HTTP message to send to the client
signature: string | Error | { message: string | Error; attributes?: Record<string, any> | undefined; } | undefined

children.label: headers
description: HTTP Headers with additional information about response
signature: Record<"accept" | "accept-language" | "accept-patch" | "accept-ranges" | "access-control-allow-credentials" | "access-control-allow-headers" | "access-control-allow-methods" | "access-control-allow-origin" | "access-control-expose-headers" | "access-control-max-age" | "access-control-request-headers" | "access-control-request-method" | "age" | "allow" | "alt-svc" | "authorization" | "cache-control" | "connection" | "content-disposition" | "content-encoding" | "content-language" | "content-length" | "content-location" | "content-range" | "content-type" | "cookie" | "date" | "expect" | "expires" | "forwarded" | "from" | "host" | "if-match" | "if-modified-since" | "if-none-match" | "if-unmodified-since" | "last-modified" | "location" | "origin" | "pragma" | "proxy-authenticate" | "proxy-authorization" | "public-key-pins" | "range" | "referer" | "retry-after" | "sec-websocket-accept" | "sec-websocket-extensions" | "sec-websocket-key" | "sec-websocket-protocol" | "sec-websocket-version" | "set-cookie" | "strict-transport-security" | "tk" | "trailer" | "transfer-encoding" | "upgrade" | "user-agent" | "vary" | "via" | "warning" | "www-authenticate", string | string[]> | Record<string, string | string[]> | undefined

children.label: get
description:
Gets authentication state for a request. Returned by `auth` interceptor.
{@link GetAuthState}

children.label: isAuthenticated
description:
Returns authentication status for a request.
{@link IsAuthenticated}

interfaces.label: HttpResponseOptions
description: HTTP response parameters

children.label: body
description: HTTP message to send to the client

children.label: headers
description: HTTP Headers with additional information about response
signature: Record<"accept" | "accept-language" | "accept-patch" | "accept-ranges" | "access-control-allow-credentials" | "access-control-allow-headers" | "access-control-allow-methods" | "access-control-allow-origin" | "access-control-expose-headers" | "access-control-max-age" | "access-control-request-headers" | "access-control-request-method" | "age" | "allow" | "alt-svc" | "authorization" | "cache-control" | "connection" | "content-disposition" | "content-encoding" | "content-language" | "content-length" | "content-location" | "content-range" | "content-type" | "cookie" | "date" | "expect" | "expires" | "forwarded" | "from" | "host" | "if-match" | "if-modified-since" | "if-none-match" | "if-unmodified-since" | "last-modified" | "location" | "origin" | "pragma" | "proxy-authenticate" | "proxy-authorization" | "public-key-pins" | "range" | "referer" | "retry-after" | "sec-websocket-accept" | "sec-websocket-extensions" | "sec-websocket-key" | "sec-websocket-protocol" | "sec-websocket-version" | "set-cookie" | "strict-transport-security" | "tk" | "trailer" | "transfer-encoding" | "upgrade" | "user-agent" | "vary" | "via" | "warning" | "www-authenticate", string | string[]> | Record<string, string | string[]> | undefined

children.label: bypassErrorFormat
description: Bypass the default error formatting

interfaces.label: HttpServerInfo
description:
Information about what hostname, port, and protocol the server process is
running on. Note that this may not match the URL that end-users access
Kibana at. For the public URL, see {@link BasePath.publicBaseUrl}.

children.label: name
description: The name of the Kibana server

children.label: hostname
description: The hostname of the server

children.label: port
description: The port the server is listening on

children.label: protocol
description: The protocol used by the server

interfaces.label: HttpServiceSetup
description:
Kibana HTTP Service provides own abstraction for work with HTTP stack.
Plugins don't have direct access to `hapi` server and its primitives anymore. Moreover,
plugins shouldn't rely on the fact that HTTP Service uses one or another library under the hood.
This gives the platform flexibility to upgrade or changing our internal HTTP stack without breaking plugins.
If the HTTP Service lacks functionality you need, we are happy to discuss and support your needs.

children.label: createCookieSessionStorageFactory
description: Creates cookie based session storage factory {@link SessionStorageFactory}

children.label: registerOnPreRouting
description: To define custom logic to perform for incoming requests before server performs a route lookup.

children.label: registerOnPreAuth
description:
To define custom logic to perform for incoming requests before
the Auth interceptor performs a check that user has access to requested resources.

children.label: registerAuth
description: To define custom authentication and/or authorization mechanism for incoming requests.

children.label: registerOnPostAuth
description: To define custom logic after Auth interceptor did make sure a user has access to the requested resource.

children.label: registerOnPreResponse
description: To define custom logic to perform for the server response.

children.label: basePath
description:
Access or manipulate the Kibana base path
See {@link IBasePath}.

children.label: auth
description:
Auth status.
See {@link HttpAuth}

children.label: csp
description: The CSP config used for Kibana.

children.label: createRouter
description: Provides ability to declare a handler function for a particular path and HTTP request method.

children.label: registerRouteHandlerContext
description: Register a context provider for a route handler.
signature: , ContextName extends keyof Context>(contextName: ContextName, provider:

children.label: getServerInfo
description: Provides common {@link HttpServerInfo | information} about the running http server.

children.label: basePath
description:
Access or manipulate the Kibana base path
See {@link IBasePath}.

children.label: auth
description:
Auth status.
See {@link HttpAuth}

children.label: getServerInfo
description: Provides common {@link HttpServerInfo | information} about the running http server.

interfaces.label: IKibanaResponse
description: A response data object, expected to returned as a result of {@link RequestHandler} execution

interfaces.label: IKibanaSocket
description: A tiny abstraction for TCP socket.

children.label: getPeerCertificate
description:
Returns an object representing the peer's certificate.
The returned object has some properties corresponding to the field of the certificate.
If detailed argument is true the full chain with issuer property will be returned,
if false only the top certificate without issuer property.
If the peer does not provide a certificate, it returns null.

children.label: detailed
description: - If true; the full chain with issuer property will be returned.

returnComment: An object representing the peer's certificate.

children.label: getProtocol
description:
Returns a string containing the negotiated SSL/TLS protocol version of the current connection. The value 'unknown' will be returned for
connected sockets that have not completed the handshaking process. The value null will be returned for server sockets or disconnected
client sockets. See https://www.openssl.org/docs/man1.0.2/ssl/SSL_get_version.html for more information.

children.label: renegotiate
description: Renegotiates a connection to obtain the peer's certificate. This cannot be used when the protocol version is TLSv1.3.
signature: (options: { rejectUnauthorized?: boolean | undefined; requestCert?: boolean | undefined; }) => Promise<void>
returnComment: A Promise that will be resolved if renegotiation succeeded, or will be rejected if renegotiation failed.

children.label: authorized
description:
Indicates whether or not the peer certificate was signed by one of the specified CAs. When TLS
isn't used the value is `undefined`.

children.label: authorizationError
description:
The reason why the peer's certificate has not been verified. This property becomes available
only when `authorized` is `false`.

interfaces.label: IRouter
description:
Registers route handlers for specified resource path and method.
See {@link RouteConfig} and {@link RequestHandler} for more information about arguments to route registrations.

children.label: routerPath
description: Resulted path

children.label: get
description: Register a route handler for `GET` request.

children.label: post
description: Register a route handler for `POST` request.

children.label: put
description: Register a route handler for `PUT` request.

children.label: patch
description: Register a route handler for `PATCH` request.

children.label: delete
description: Register a route handler for `DELETE` request.

children.label: handleLegacyErrors
description: Wrap a router handler to catch and converts legacy boom errors to proper custom errors.

interfaces.label: KibanaRequestEvents
description: Request events.

children.label: aborted$
description: Observable that emits once if and when the request has been aborted.

children.label: completed$
description: Observable that emits once if and when the request has been completely handled.

interfaces.label: KibanaRequestRoute
description: Request specific route information exposed to a handler.

children.label: next
description: To pass request to the next handler

children.label: next
description: To pass request to the next handler

interfaces.label: OnPreResponseExtensions
description: Additional data to extend a response.

children.label: headers
description: additional headers to attach to the response
signature: Record<"accept" | "accept-language" | "accept-patch" | "accept-ranges" | "access-control-allow-credentials" | "access-control-allow-headers" | "access-control-allow-methods" | "access-control-allow-origin" | "access-control-expose-headers" | "access-control-max-age" | "access-control-request-headers" | "access-control-request-method" | "age" | "allow" | "alt-svc" | "authorization" | "cache-control" | "connection" | "content-disposition" | "content-encoding" | "content-language" | "content-length" | "content-location" | "content-range" | "content-type" | "cookie" | "date" | "expect" | "expires" | "forwarded" | "from" | "host" | "if-match" | "if-modified-since" | "if-none-match" | "if-unmodified-since" | "last-modified" | "location" | "origin" | "pragma" | "proxy-authenticate" | "proxy-authorization" | "public-key-pins" | "range" | "referer" | "retry-after" | "sec-websocket-accept" | "sec-websocket-extensions" | "sec-websocket-key" | "sec-websocket-protocol" | "sec-websocket-version" | "set-cookie" | "strict-transport-security" | "tk" | "trailer" | "transfer-encoding" | "upgrade" | "user-agent" | "vary" | "via" | "warning" | "www-authenticate", string | string[]> | Record<string, string | string[]> | undefined

interfaces.label: OnPreResponseInfo
description: Response status code.

interfaces.label: OnPreResponseRender
description: Additional data to extend a response when rendering a new body

children.label: headers
description: additional headers to attach to the response
signature: Record<"accept" | "accept-language" | "accept-patch" | "accept-ranges" | "access-control-allow-credentials" | "access-control-allow-headers" | "access-control-allow-methods" | "access-control-allow-origin" | "access-control-expose-headers" | "access-control-max-age" | "access-control-request-headers" | "access-control-request-method" | "age" | "allow" | "alt-svc" | "authorization" | "cache-control" | "connection" | "content-disposition" | "content-encoding" | "content-language" | "content-length" | "content-location" | "content-range" | "content-type" | "cookie" | "date" | "expect" | "expires" | "forwarded" | "from" | "host" | "if-match" | "if-modified-since" | "if-none-match" | "if-unmodified-since" | "last-modified" | "location" | "origin" | "pragma" | "proxy-authenticate" | "proxy-authorization" | "public-key-pins" | "range" | "referer" | "retry-after" | "sec-websocket-accept" | "sec-websocket-extensions" | "sec-websocket-key" | "sec-websocket-protocol" | "sec-websocket-version" | "set-cookie" | "strict-transport-security" | "tk" | "trailer" | "transfer-encoding" | "upgrade" | "user-agent" | "vary" | "via" | "warning" | "www-authenticate", string | string[]> | Record<string, string | string[]> | undefined

children.label: body
description: the body to use in the response

interfaces.label: OnPreResponseToolkit
description: A tool set defining an outcome of OnPreResponse interceptor for incoming request.

children.label: render
description: To override the response with a different body

children.label: next
description: To pass request to the next handler

children.label: next
description: To pass request to the next handler

children.label: rewriteUrl
description: Rewrite requested resources url before is was authenticated and routed to a handler

interfaces.label: RouteConfig
description: Route specific configuration.

children.label: path
description: The endpoint _within_ the router path to register the route.

children.label: validate
description: A schema created with `@kbn/config-schema` that every request will be validated against.

children.label: options
description: Additional route options {@link RouteConfigOptions}.

interfaces.label: RouteConfigOptions
description: Additional route options.

children.label: authRequired
description:
Defines authentication mode for a route:
- true. A user has to have valid credentials to access a resource
- false. A user can access a resource without any credentials.
- 'optional'. A user can access a resource, and will be authenticated if provided credentials are valid.
              Can be useful when we grant access to a resource but want to identify a user if possible.

Defaults to `true` if an auth mechanism is registered.

children.label: xsrfRequired
description:
Defines xsrf protection requirements for a route:
- true. Requires an incoming POST/PUT/DELETE request to contain `kbn-xsrf` header.
- false. Disables xsrf protection.

Set to true by default

children.label: tags
description: Additional metadata tag strings to attach to the route.

children.label: body
description: Additional body options {@link RouteConfigOptionsBody}.

children.label: timeout
description: Defines per-route timeouts.
signature: ? undefined : number) | undefined; idleSocket?: number | undefined; } | undefined

interfaces.label: RouteConfigOptionsBody
description: Additional body options for a route

children.label: accepts
description:
A string or an array of strings with the allowed mime types for the endpoint. Use this settings to limit the set of allowed mime types. Note that allowing additional mime types not listed
above will not enable them to be parsed, and if parse is true, the request will result in an error response.

Default value: allows parsing of the following mime types:
* application/json
* application/*+json
* application/octet-stream
* application/x-www-form-urlencoded
* multipart/form-data
* text/*

children.label: maxBytes
description:
Limits the size of incoming payloads to the specified byte count. Allowing very large payloads may cause the server to run out of memory.

Default value: The one set in the kibana.yml config file under the parameter `server.maxPayload`.

children.label: output
description:
The processed payload format. The value must be one of:
* 'data' - the incoming payload is read fully into memory. If parse is true, the payload is parsed (JSON, form-decoded, multipart) based on the 'Content-Type' header. If parse is false, a raw
Buffer is returned.
* 'stream' - the incoming payload is made available via a Stream.Readable interface. If the payload is 'multipart/form-data' and parse is true, field values are presented as text while files
are provided as streams. File streams from a 'multipart/form-data' upload will also have a hapi property containing the filename and headers properties. Note that payload streams for multipart
payloads are a synthetic interface created on top of the entire multipart content loaded into memory. To avoid loading large multipart payloads into memory, set parse to false and handle the
multipart payload in the handler using a streaming parser (e.g. pez).

Default value: 'data', unless no validation.body is provided in the route definition. In that case the default is 'stream' to alleviate memory pressure.

children.label: parse
description:
Determines if the incoming payload is processed or presented raw. Available values:
* true - if the request 'Content-Type' matches the allowed mime types set by allow (for the whole payload as well as parts), the payload is converted into an object when possible. If the
format is unknown, a Bad Request (400) error response is sent. Any known content encoding is decoded.
* false - the raw payload is returned unmodified.
* 'gunzip' - the raw payload is returned unmodified after any known content encoding is decoded.

Default value: true, unless no validation.body is provided in the route definition. In that case the default is false to alleviate memory pressure.

interfaces.label: RouteValidationResultFactory
description:
Validation result factory to be used in the custom validation function to return the valid data or validation errors

See {@link RouteValidationFunction}.

children.label: badRequest
signature: (error: string | Error, path?: string[] | undefined) => { error:

interfaces.label: RouteValidatorConfig
description:
The configuration object to the RouteValidator class.
Set `params`, `query` and/or `body` to specify the validation logic to follow for that property.

children.label: params
description: Validation logic for the URL params

children.label: query
description: Validation logic for the Query params

children.label: body
description: Validation logic for the body payload

interfaces.label: RouteValidatorOptions
description: Additional options for the RouteValidator class to modify its default behaviour.

children.label: unsafe
description: Set the `unsafe` config to avoid running some additional internal *safe* validations on top of your custom validation
signature: { params?: boolean | undefined; query?: boolean | undefined; body?: boolean | undefined; } | undefined

interfaces.label: SessionCookieValidationResult
description: Return type from a function to validate cookie contents.

children.label: isValid
description: Whether the cookie is valid or not.

children.label: path
description: The "Path" attribute of the cookie; if the cookie is invalid, this is used to clear it.

interfaces.label: SessionStorage
description: Provides an interface to store and retrieve data across requests.

children.label: get
description: Retrieves session value from the session storage.

children.label: set
description: Puts current session value into the session storage.

children.label: sessionValue
description: - value to put

children.label: clear
description: Clears current session.

interfaces.label: SessionStorageCookieOptions
description: Configuration used to create HTTP session storage based on top of cookie mechanism.

children.label: name
description: Name of the session cookie.

children.label: encryptionKey
description: A key used to encrypt a cookie's value. Should be at least 32 characters long.

children.label: validate
description: Function called to validate a cookie's decrypted value.

children.label: isSecure
description: Flag indicating whether the cookie should be sent only via a secure connection.

children.label: sameSite
description:
Defines SameSite attribute of the Set-Cookie Header.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Set-Cookie/SameSite

interfaces.label: SessionStorageFactory
description: SessionStorage factory to bind one to an incoming request

misc.label: RequestHandler
description:
A function executed when route path matched requested resource path.
Request handler is expected to return a result of one of {@link KibanaResponseFactory} functions.
If anything else is returned, or an error is thrown, the HTTP service will automatically log the error
and respond `500 - Internal Server Error`.
